Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth

Class DKIMMessageParser.RawHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.auth.DKIMMessageParser.RawHeader
  • Enclosing class:
    DKIMMessageParser
    public static class DKIMMessageParser.RawHeader
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores a raw header with name and bytes.

    For DKIM canonicalization:

    • Simple mode: Use getBytes() - preserves CRLF at fold points exactly as received
    • Relaxed mode: Use getBytesUnfolded() - removes CRLF at fold points (keeps the continuation whitespace)

    Note: The final line-ending CRLF is preserved in both modes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String asString()
      Returns the raw header as a string using ISO-8859-1 encoding.
      java.lang.String asStringUnfolded()
      Returns the unfolded header as a string using ISO-8859-1 encoding.
      byte[] getBytes()
      Returns the raw header bytes for simple canonicalization.
      byte[] getBytesUnfolded()
      Returns the header bytes with fold CRLFs removed.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the header name.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the header name.
        Returns:
        the header name (original case preserved)

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Returns the raw header bytes for simple canonicalization.

        Includes CRLF at fold points exactly as received. This is the format needed for DKIM "simple" header canonicalization.

        Returns:
        the raw bytes with fold CRLFs preserved

      • getBytesUnfolded

        public byte[] getBytesUnfolded()
        Returns the header bytes with fold CRLFs removed.

        Removes CRLF (or LF) at fold points but keeps the continuation whitespace (space or tab). The final line-ending is preserved. This is the format needed for DKIM "relaxed" header canonicalization (before further whitespace processing).

        A fold is detected as CRLF (or LF) followed by a space or tab.

        Returns:
        the bytes with fold line-endings stripped

      • asString

        public java.lang.String asString()
        Returns the raw header as a string using ISO-8859-1 encoding. This preserves the byte values exactly (simple mode).
        Returns:
        the header as string with fold CRLFs preserved

      • asStringUnfolded

        public java.lang.String asStringUnfolded()
        Returns the unfolded header as a string using ISO-8859-1 encoding.
        Returns:
        the header as string with fold CRLFs removed
